trustfund: TF039528-LATVIA - MARKET STRUCTURE AND REGULATION,TF026117-PHRD-STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT LOAN II

abstracts.cdata!:
The Programmatic Structural Adjustment
            Loan Project (PSAL) supports Latvia's reform program.
            It is envisaged that over the three-year period of the
            reform program, there could be up to three single or two
            tranche PSALs to support its implementation. The reform
            program will help Latvia return to a macroeconomic framework
            conducive to growth and improve its public sector
            performance by 1) correcting macro-economic imbalances, 2)
            strengthening the credibility of the public sector, 3)
            improving institutional capacity to deliver public services,
            and 4) encouraging private sector development through
            finalizing the privatization process and defining a clear
            and transparent regulatory framework. Latvia expects to
            achieve these objectives by implementing specific reforms
            supported by the World Bank in the areas of pensions, public
            sector management, human resource management, public
            expenditure management, privatization and regulation of
            public utilities and private business. The PSAL will also
            put in place measures to assist the government's
            anti-corruption effort and to streamline business
            regulation. The reforms will enhance Latvia's prospects
            for timely European Union accession; and provide a positive
            signal to international institutions and investors regarding
            the government's commitment to reform and the
            transition to a full-fledged market economy.
